p: To estimate climate impacts on biomass growth, we use stock assessment data for Sardinella aurita by the Food and Agriculture organization (FAO) working group on the assessment of small pelagic fish off Northwest Africa. In the years 1995–2006, catch independent surveys were carried out in the fourth quarter of each year by the research vessel R/V Dr FRIDTJOF NANSEN [ 35– 40]. National surveys provide estimates for 2007–2009 [ 41– 43]. The working group used regression models to account for occasional regional gaps. We present a figure containing yearly abundance estimates in Section A of the supporting information S1 File. The development over time shows substantial variability, which has been attributed to upwelling variability and associated variations in primary productivity [ 29, 34, 44].
